column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////I came here to try out the deep dish pizza and I was not disappointed! I ordered a personal sized classic deep dish pizza with the minestrone soup as an appetizer. In retrospect
column2: it probably would have been better to call ahead and order
column3: as they said it takes about 45 minutes to prepare a deep dish pizza. The minestrone soup was tasty; I'm not too familiar with the cuisine
column4: so I don't know what minestrone soup is "supposed" to be
column5: but I was pretty happy with mine. When the pizza finally came out
column6: it did not disappoint. The sausage disk was super tasty
column7: as was the generous amounts of melty cheese. The crust was also crispy and tasty by itself which was awesome. Overall
column8: I had a great experience and would definitely come back again.
